DynamicPage.Title: Help Edit
DynamicPage.Content: This is a short explanation about edit page options: Links You can link to an external page using: \[\[\\]\] an example, if you write: \[\[http://www.ajlopez.com\]\] you get: [[http://www.ajlopez.com]] If the url starts with ~/ it will be expanded to the current application path: \[\[~/Default.aspx\]\] [[~/Default.aspx]] Link to a Dynamic Page You can link to this page using \[\[PageEditPageHelp\]\] you get: [[PageEditPageHelp]] Text in a Link You can add a text in a link, using a | as separator \[\[PageEditPageHelp|Edit Help\]\] you get: [[PageEditPageHelp|Edit Help]] A text can be added to an URL using the same separator: \[\[http://www.ajlopez.com/ajgenesis|AjGenesis Project\]\] [[http://www.ajlopez.com/ajgenesis|AjGenesis Project]] Using HTML You can use HTML at any point Breaking lines If you enter a empty line, a pair of \ (line break in HTML) will be inserted. Images You can indicate an image using: \[\[image:\\]\] You can give a relative (to the root of this application) address: \[\[image:images/logo.gif\]\] Using HTML Special Characters If you need to write one of these characters: \\, \<, \>, \[, \] you must precede it with an slash, as in: \\\\, \\\<, \\\>, \\\[, \\\]
